channel.title: Prayer?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I was wondering if anyone here knows how to fix prayer. My prayer protect spells are working fine, but the emblem above my head isn't. Here are some pictures to let you know what i mean:
Protect From Melee:
[img]http://i50.tinypic.com/idsmrr.jpg[/img]
Protect From Range:
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/110yo0m.jpg[/img]
Protect From Mage:
[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/vffj40.jpg[/img]
As you can see, The picutres are all wrong, and for mage there isn't even anything, its just empty. If anyone Knows how to fix this, that would be greatly appreciated. Thanx!

item.title: Prayer?
item.dc:creator: @kool_dude567 kool dude567
item.description:
@kool_dude567 wrote:

Thanks for trying Spades but I have those spirts. In class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 I seem to be MISSING my headicons thing. Like here is a code of one of them:

[code]else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase(“PRAYERON”) && (i == 0 || i == 1 || i == 2 || i == 3 || i == 4 || i == 5 || i == 6 || i == 7 || i == 8 || i == 9 || i == 10 || i == 11 || i == 12 || i == 13 || i == 14 || i == 15 || i == 16 || i == 17))
{
try
{
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./cache/Files/interface/"+s+" “+i+”.png");
anInt1440 = 33;
anInt1441 = 320;
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

		}
		catch (Exception exception)
		{
			System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
		}
	} [/code]

If anyone could look into their file of Class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 and see if they have like a headicons one for prayer, that would be great. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer?
item.dc:creator: @kool_dude567 kool dude567
item.description:
@kool_dude567 wrote:

I can’t figure out how to change it, because when i changed skulls to prayers, i got an error. Here is where it is in player.java

[code]
playerProps.writeByte(headIcon);
playerProps.writeByte(skulls);
playerProps.writeByte(hint);

	// playerStatusMask - skull, prayers etc alkup 0

	// defining the character shape - 12 slots following - 0 denotes a null
	// entry and just a byte is used
	// slot 0,8,11,1 is head part - missing additional things are beard and
	// eyepatch like things either 11 or 1
	// cape, apron, amulet... the remaining things...
	if (isNpc == false) {[/code]

if you can help with that, that would be great.

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer?
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

Edit your player.java, source sided and change headiconspk to headiconsprayer (mostly)

your source is telling the client to look for the prayer headicons in the same cache directory as the skulls, so you just need to fix that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

Maybe it’s the sprites, if is not use the cache suite and change the skulls into prayer protects. That may fix it. Still help add my msn: mafkeesmaf@live.nl

item.title: Prayer?
item.dc:creator: @kool_dude567 kool dude567
item.description:
@kool_dude567 wrote:

i am using bluur’s client so you’re correct, but how do i fix the sprites and make it so that the headicons are correct?

item.title: Prayer?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

not sure whats the problem here, that looks like bluurs client, so the sprites are probably OK, the server tells the prayer what headicon to display, and its giving the wrong ones, and i dont know the ids of each headicon so i cant really help…

narrowing it down: your problem is the sprites in your cache are jumbled up, or your server is telling the client to load the wrong headicons.

Read full topic
